programme.title: Ubijanje Eve
programme.desc: Eve je operativka sigurnosne službe. Veoma je pametna, dosadan joj je kancelarijski posao, i ne ispunjava njena maštanja o tome da postane špijun. Villanelle je otmjena, voli luksuz, koji joj pruža... Eve je operativka sigurnosne službe. Veoma je pametna, dosadan joj je kancelarijski posao, i ne ispunjava njena maštanja o tome da postane špijun. Villanelle je otmjena, voli luksuz, koji joj pruža njen muž, ali je i talentirana ubica... Ove dvije izrazito inteligentne žene, podjednako opsjednute jedna drugom, direktno se sukobljavaju u epskoj igri mačke i miša.

programme.title: The 6th Day
Šesti dan
programme.desc: The 6th Day: Directed by Roger Spottiswoode. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Michael Rapaport, Tony Goldwyn, Michael Rooker. A man meets a clone of himself and stumbles into a grand conspiracy about clones taking over the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0216216/","name":"The 6th Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1OTU5OTU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjMxMDk2._V1_.jpg","description":"A man meets a clone of himself and stumbles into a grand conspiracy about clones taking over the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0216216/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"npel"},"dateCreated":"2001-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Multiplicity meets Total Recall","reviewBody":"This movie felt like a combination of Michael Keaton's 1996 clone comedy, Multiplicity and Schwarzenegger's own Total Recall. Schwarzenegger is a helicopter pilot who after signing a big chartering contract with a wealthy tycoon, returns home on the night of his birthday and discovers that he's already home enjoying his birthday cake. Through the rest of the film, Arney is running from the bad guys who are trying to kill him for seeing his double and trying to learn why he has been cloned. I didn't mind this film and I actually found myself chuckling at Arnold's remarks after each kill. The dialog between the two Schwarzenegger's was kind of tacky but the special effects and action sequences make up for that. I wonder how much World Wrestling Federation owner Vince McMahon paid out to have his new XFL football league appear in the film?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":119226,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2001-02-07","keywords":"evil man,cloning,clone,future,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The 6th Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1502478617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZlYjkwMzYtZmVjOS00YzcyLThkNTctYjFhYjA3ZDA1NzQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZlYjkwMzYtZmVjOS00YzcyLThkNTctYjFhYjA3ZDA1NzQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001650/","name":"Michael Rapaport"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001282/","name":"Tony Goldwyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006854/","name":"Roger Spottiswoode"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029574/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926727/","name":"Cormac Wibberley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926729/","name":"Marianne Wibberley"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes
Greystoke: Legenda o Tarzanu
programme.desc: Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes: Directed by Hugh Hudson. With Ralph Richardson, Ian Holm, James Fox, Christopher Lambert. A missing heir of respected Scottish family, raised in African jungles by animals, finally returns to his estate only to realize that difference between the two worlds is really significant." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087365/","name":"Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2NmYjZjOGItYTQ0ZC00YjcyLTk3MWUtYzdmZjY1MGNkMDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A missing heir of respected Scottish family, raised in African jungles by animals, finally returns to his estate only to realize that difference between the two worlds is really significant.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087365/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pegasus7"},"dateCreated":"2002-02-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quite surprisingly enjoyable","reviewBody":"Once you get past the first notion of the unlikeliness of the actual events in the story, you'll enjoy this film a lot more. I have seen this movie several times, and still enjoy it. Although i find Christopher Lambert a mediocre actor in most of his films, i feel that he shines here (a good idea to let him speak in his native French accent, cleverly written into the script by means of the Belgian explorer who finds him)instead of making him put on a bizarre accent, and it works well. Ian Holm and Ralph Richardson are fantastic and moving, but McDowell spoils it again and most of her scenes are irritating to watch. Some of this movie was actually quite upsetting (the taxidermy labs and the scene where the ape/father is shot) but very well done. The scenery is fantastic, and the musical score is brilliant and stirring. Great make-up effects for its day. This movie is well worth watching, give it a try, you might be pleasantly surprised!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19641,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1984-03-30","keywords":"year 1885,shipwreck,africa,ape,orphan","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1200997145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjg3NWI4MmUtY2UzOC00OWUxLTk5MTYtMzNkYzc2MGQyMzU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjg3NWI4MmUtY2UzOC00OWUxLTk5MTYtMzNkYzc2MGQyMzU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A missing heir of respected Scottish family, raised in African jungles by animals, finally returns to his estate only to realize that difference between the two worlds is really significant."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000483/","name":"Christopher Lambert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000510/","name":"Andie MacDowell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724732/","name":"Ralph Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0399853/","name":"Hugh Hudson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128312/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043388/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0123194/","name":"Edgar Rice Burroughs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001801/","name":"Robert Towne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0042472/","name":"Michael Austin"}],"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

I have seen this movie several times, and still enjoy it. Although i find Christopher Lambert a mediocre actor in most of his films, i feel that he shines here (a good idea to let him speak in his native French accent, cleverly written into the script by means of the Belgian explorer who finds him)instead of making him put on a bizarre accent, and it works well. programme.title: Treasure Island
Otok s blagom
programme.desc: Treasure Island: Directed by Fraser C. Heston. With Charlton Heston, Christian Bale, Oliver Reed, Christopher Lee. The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate Captain Long John Silver." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100813/","name":"Treasure Island","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEzZmVhOGEtNTMxMy00YmE4LTk1YzQtMjcxMWI1ZDc2MWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate Captain Long John Silver.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100813/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hans101067"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Rousing Adaptation Follows Novel Closely","reviewBody":"This version of Stevenson's masterpiece is probably the one that most closely follows the novel.It appears that they must have had a copy alongside when they were writing the script.Oh,we can certainly have criticisms,of inaccuracies,and diversions,but they're so small.Bale is some flat as Jim Hawkins,and he does appear a little dull-witted(which is NOT the same as being stupid)but what of it.He's the closest in age of any interpreter.I've heard people complain of Heston being cast against type as Silver,stating that he's not doing a hero.Nonsense!Silver happens to be an evil hero!Wood's Smollet is a little too young for the character,and Halsey and Coyle are both much too young for theirs(Hands and Morgan are described as rather elderly pirates)but what of it?They do a fine job.The fight at the stockade is much more elaborate than was described in the book,but can we have a Heston film that doesn't have an epic battle?Besides,it's so much fun.And Silver's escape is not as described in the novel,but it's so original,and so much in character,that we have to cheer the old blackguard in his resourcefulness.Get the video,stock up lots of beverages,make lots of popcorn,and settle back for a rousing,rollicking good time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5104,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"Not programme.title: The New Guy
Nova faca
programme.desc: The New Guy: Directed by Ed Decter. With DJ Qualls, Eliza Dushku, Zooey Deschanel, Jerod Mixon. A high school senior branded uncool in the ninth grade gets himself expelled so he changes his image to cool kid at the town's other high school." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0241760/","name":"The New Guy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzg4MDljNzYtNjNmNC00OThkLWIzMGEtZDc2Y2Y4MWZkNTc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high school senior branded uncool in the ninth grade gets himself expelled so he changes his image to cool kid at the town's other high school.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0241760/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sigmoid23"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's not about the story. It's about the fun.","reviewBody":"A lot of people will say the plot of this movie was lame, predictable and dumb and yeah, they're right. But this kind of movie isn't about a brilliant plot. It's about interesting characters and silly gags and parodying those more serious types of movies. There are some funny lines, sight gags and slapstick, some cute girls, the bad guys get what's coming to them and the good guys win. Throw in some surprising celebrity cameos (some of which you might not catch until the credits roll) and a great soundtrack that mixes old and new songs and that's what I call entertainment.\n\nThe cast is noteworthy too. DJ Qualls, of course, Zooey Deschanel (the chick from Elf), Eddie Griffin, Lyle Lovett, Jerod Mixon, Parry Shen, Matt Gogin etc. did a fine job. A high school senior branded uncool in the ninth grade gets himself expelled so he changes his image to cool kid at the town's other high school." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0241760/","name":"The New Guy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzg4MDljNzYtNjNmNC00OThkLWIzMGEtZDc2Y2Y4MWZkNTc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high school senior branded uncool in the ninth grade gets himself expelled so he changes his image to cool kid at the town's other high school.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0241760/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sigmoid23","dateCreated":"2006-01-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's not about the story. It's about the fun.","reviewBody":"A lot of people will say the plot of this movie was lame, predictable and dumb and yeah, they're right. But this kind of movie isn't about a brilliant plot. It's about interesting characters and silly gags and parodying those more serious types of movies. There are some funny lines, sight gags and slapstick, some cute girls, the bad guys get what's coming to them and the good guys win. Throw in some surprising celebrity cameos (some of which you might not catch until the credits roll) and a great soundtrack that mixes old and new songs and that's what I call entertainment.\n\nThe cast is noteworthy too. DJ Qualls, of course, Zooey Deschanel (the chick from Elf), Eddie Griffin, Lyle Lovett, Jerod Mixon, Parry Shen, Matt Gogin etc. did a fine job. If you can watch a movie without being hypercritical about how "bad" it is, then get this, sit back a have some laughs","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34716,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-05-10","keywords":"teenage boy,teenage girl,attempted escape,three word title,bass guitar","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The New Guy","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1978728729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MTUyNGUtOTk2NS00OTRiLTk4MzctNzVjNzIxZGVlNWRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MTUyNGUtOTk2NS00OTRiLTk4MzctNzVjNzIxZGVlNWRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0702809/","name":"DJ Qualls","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005164/","name":"Lyle Lovett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0244630/","name":"Eliza Dushku"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214036/","name":"Ed Decter"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063206/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024252/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0447583/","name":"David Kendall"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cube Zero
Kocka: Početak
programme.desc:
Cube Zero: Directed by Ernie Barbarash. With Zachary Bennett, David Huband, Stephanie Moore, Martin Roach. A young programmer whose job is to watch over the reality-warping Cube defies orders to rescue an innocent mother trapped in one of its rooms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0377713/","name":"Cube Zero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3ZmQ3YWQtM2ViNS00Mzk4LTk1ZWQtMWIyZTdkYzA5NjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer whose job is to watch over the reality-warping Cube defies orders to rescue an innocent mother trapped in one of its rooms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0377713/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"morphion2"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not Awful, but Unnecessary","reviewBody":"Following the release of Cube 2: Hypercube (2003), and playing off the alleged success of the original Cube (1998), Director Ernie Barbarash takes the liberty of bringing us the third installment in the trilogy, the prequel Cube Zero.

Deep in the bowels of a giant and faceless institution, time and place unknown, two low-ranking operators, Wynn (Zachary Bennett) and Dodd (David Huband) sit and observe on monitors the behavior of people that have been placed in a giant network of cubic chambers, some of which are rigged with death traps. Told that the people they are observing are convicted felons who chose this horrific and deadly ordeal over a lethal injection, these observers have had no problem with their jobs until Wynn, a mathematical genius, discovers that one of the prisoners, a woman named Cassandra (Stephanie Moore) never agreed to be put inside the Cube. Suddenly it's realized that perhaps their "jobs" are not what they seem, and that they may be part of something deeply sick and twisted...

For people that have seen and enjoyed the original Cube, this prequel will probably not be to your liking. It's not that the story does not have potential; it's simply that the first Cube film never needed to be expanded on. Standing alone, it is a neat little psychological thriller with very interesting concepts and a certainty about its own message. It was also nicely self-contained. The problem with Cube Zero is that it destroys some of the mystique of the original, attempting to answer questions with more questions but only really resulting in making a mess of what never needed fixing.

What this new film has to offer, which is questions about the psychological nature of authoritarianism and the banality of evil, certainly are good questions to be raised, but probably should have been done so on their own merits, rather than as a continuation of a film that had no such aspirations.

Having said this, the other traits of the film, such as acting and direction and writing, are not awful. There is a bleak, dark look to the film akin to such film noir as 'The Matrix' and 'Dark City', and they have certainly managed to recapture the claustrophobic feeling of the first Cube. Unfortunately for Barbarash, these are not enough positive qualities to save it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39410,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2004-11-10","keywords":"cyberpunk,part of trilogy,third part,underwater scene,countdown","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0072124/","name":"Zachary Bennett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601890/","name":"Stephanie Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730045/","name":"Martin Roach"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053228/","name":"Ernie Barbarash"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016889/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053228/","name":"Ernie Barbarash"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn
Od sumraka do zore
programme.desc: From Dusk Till Dawn: Directed by Robert Rodriguez. With George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel, Juliette Lewis. Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge in a truck stop populated by vampires, with chaotic results." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116367/","name":"From Dusk Till Dawn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjk3YmZhMDAtOWUzMS00YjE5LTkxNzAtY2I1NGZjMDA2ZTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge in a truck stop populated by vampires, with chaotic results.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116367/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Son_of_Mansfield"},"dateCreated":"2003-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"If Seth Gecko had taken on those tomatoes, they never would have eaten France.","reviewBody":"George Clooney should have stuck will this kind of role. He did fine in Out of Sight and Ocean's Eleven, but he really dominated this movie with a fury that we may never see again. Almost every line he delivers is memorable and that is not all Tarantino's doing. The rest of the cast is dominated by cool cameos and veteran cult and mainstream names. The exception being Ernest Liu who does a good job of holding his own. No Tarantino film would be complete without a good soundtrack. This one, as with Desperado, features songs by Tito and Tarantula. Although I have only heard four songs by them, I consider them one of my favorites. I will never forget what my parents told me after they watched this without me. "You sure can pick 'em," my mother blurted with distain. Do not make my mistake, watch it with your parents to see them squirm.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":299216,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Horror"],"datePublished":"1996-01-19","keywords":"stripper,held hostage,u.s. mexico border,priest,strip club","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"From Dusk Till Dawn","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3052320281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVjZDY5ODAtZDg2Ny00ZDJlLTk2YzgtNmEzMjZiOWFkYmZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVjZDY5ODAtZDg2Ny00ZDJlLTk2YzgtNmEzMjZiOWFkYmZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for From Dusk Till Dawn"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000172/","name":"Harvey Keitel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000496/","name":"Juliette Lewis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001675/","name":"Robert Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0870559/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476071/","name":"Robert Kurtzman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Jeepers Creepers: Directed by Victor Salva. With Gina Philips, Justin Long, Jonathan Breck, Patricia Belcher. A brother and sister driving home through isolated countryside for spring break encounter a flesh-eating creature which is in the midst of its ritualistic eating spree." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0263488/","name":"Jeepers Creepers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwNDU0NTE0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzAzNzQyMTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A brother and sister driving home through isolated countryside for spring break encounter a flesh-eating creature which is in the midst of its ritualistic eating spree.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0263488/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"KaterinaNV"},"dateCreated":"2002-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining, but not all that","reviewBody":"I found parts of this movie, mainly the beginning to be very promising. I really thought that it was going to be an 'on the edge of your seat' horror film and the opening had all the tension and weirdness that one needs to set that kind of atmosphere. But as the movie progressed, even though it never sunk to being bad or even mediocre (no Friday the 13th B.S. here), I think it became a little bit of a disappointment because it didn't live up to the promise that it made in the beginning. And although I like to let my mind fill in the blanks, there was a lot that went unexplained that made it so that I wasn't really satisfied by the time it finished. I didn't recognize the names of the actors or the director, and they were neither here nor there for me - that's not to say that I thought the performances were bad, they definitely were fitting and on the mark for the genre. It's just that they didn't really stick out for me.\n\nAll of the above being said, if the movie was on cable on a cold winter night, I'd probably relent and watch it again - it's certainly better than most in it's category, but would I recommend it as a 'great' film? IMDb data; ttnr: 0263488, Title: Jeepers Creepers, --- Description: Jeepers Creepers: Directed by Victor Salva. With Gina Philips, Justin Long, Jonathan Breck, Patricia Belcher. A brother and sister driving home through isolated countryside for spring break encounter a flesh-eating creature which is in the midst of its ritualistic eating spree." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0263488/","name":"Jeepers Creepers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwNDU0NTE0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzAzNzQyMTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A brother and sister driving home through isolated countryside for spring break encounter a flesh-eating creature which is in the midst of its ritualistic eating spree.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0263488/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"KaterinaNV","dateCreated":"2002-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining, but not all that","reviewBody":"I found parts of this movie, mainly the beginning to be very promising. I really thought that it was going to be an 'on the edge of your seat' horror film and the opening had all the tension and weirdness that one needs to set that kind of atmosphere. But as the movie progressed, even though it never sunk to being bad or even mediocre (no Friday the 13th B.S. here), I think it became a little bit of a disappointment because it didn't live up to the promise that it made in the beginning. And although I like to let my mind fill in the blanks, there was a lot that went unexplained that made it so that I wasn't really satisfied by the time it finished. I didn't recognize the names of the actors or the director, and they were neither here nor there for me - that's not to say that I thought the performances were bad, they definitely were fitting and on the mark for the genre. It's just that they didn't really stick out for me.\n\nAll of the above being said, if the movie was on cable on a cold winter night, I'd probably relent and watch it again - it's certainly better than most in it's category, but would I recommend it as a 'great' film? No, probably not.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":119428,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2001-08-31","keywords":"demon,wings,record player,eaten alive,scarecrow","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi10009113","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmExZThlMDUtODMzNC00Mjc0LThhYWUtMTZkYTcxYzVjMDI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmExZThlMDUtODMzNC00Mjc0LThhYWUtMTZkYTcxYzVjMDI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005312/","name":"Gina Philips","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0519043/","name":"Justin Long","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0106534/","name":"Jonathan Breck"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0759207/","name":"Victor Salva"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020958/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092605/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0759207/","name":"Victor Salva"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
Talentirani gospodin Ripley
programme.desc:
The Talented Mr. Ripley: Directed by Anthony Minghella. With Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, Cate Blanchett. In late 1950s New York, Tom Ripley, a young underachiever, is sent to Italy to retrieve Dickie Greenleaf, a rich and spoiled millionaire playboy. But when the errand fails, Ripley takes extreme measures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0134119/","name":"The Talented Mr. Ripley","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA3NDhiZjYtYTk2NS00ZWYwLTljYTQtMjU0NzcyMGEzNTU2L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In late 1950s New York, Tom Ripley, a young underachiever, is sent to Italy to retrieve Dickie Greenleaf, a rich and spoiled millionaire playboy. But when the errand fails, Ripley takes extreme measures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0134119/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nathan19"},"dateCreated":"2000-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Duality makes this film an heir to Hitchcock's classics.","reviewBody":"Duality -- the ability to be one person in a certain situation, and another in another -- is the underlying and pervading theme of "The Talented Mr. Ripley." It is a theme that sparks the central conflict of the picture, that influences each of the main character's decisions and actions. Each character in the film is either pretending to be something else, or playing directly to a superficial identity. The film unravels each of the character's motivations for doing so, and in so doing strips away the layers of reality we construct for ourselves. Characters either uncover the explicit duality of their lives (Cate Blanchette's willingness to admit that she travels under another name), or have it uncovered for them (Tom Ripley). When each character is laid bare, when each character is most fully themselves, when each character stops acting and pretending, they are undone.

The film presents a main character who does his best to pursue another life -- but he cannot ultimately follow through with it. We are trapped by who we are, aren't we? Gwyneth tries to become Dickie's ideal woman, to avoid asking him to settle down, but she cannot -- she wants the home and the family. This is her undoing -- she weeps in the film, "I must have pressured him". Dickie can't escape the fact that he loves the nightlife -- that he strays, that his attention only lasts as long as the diversion. He says he will marry Gwyneth, but we know that his eye can never stop roaming. This is his undoing. Dickie's pal -- superficially polite, while snide and arrogant at the same time -- is much smarter than he appears, which leads to his undoing as well. When each of the characters lets their guard down and becomes who they are, it destroys them. Each of the characters has a tragic flaw that they try to ignore, or play to, a flaw which undoes the perfect lives they all pursue.

The ironic twist is that Tom Ripley is the catalyst for all of this -- yet, his tragic flaw is that he has no flaw. While each of the main characters has an identity they are running from, Ripley HAS no identity to speak of. He starts out pretending, and he pretends through the entire film. Who IS Tom Ripley? Even Tom himself wants to know. One would think that this would enable him to become the perfect actor -- when you paint on a blank canvas, one would think you can paint anything. But even Tom, blank as he is, distills down to someone -- even if it is a blank canvas, a "real nobody." And it is not only himself he is unsure of -- it is the entire world around him. Among his first lines in the film is a line uttered while listening to a jazz record -- he mumbles to himself, "Can't tell if it's a woman or a man." It is this uncertainty that informs the world he sees, and how he relates to it. Is Tom gay or straight? Is he evil or good? Even Tom doesn't know.

The film points out that we cannot run from our own darker half. We are all tempted to become someone else -- anyone who has been made fun of in school, who has longed for the life of the rich and famous, can identify with this The enemy is not without, it is within. It is this same duality which haunted and tormented so many of Hitchock's characters, most notably (but not exclusively) Norman Bates in "Psycho." "The Talented Mr. Ripley" is a worthy heir to that film classic in its ability to get the audience to sympathize and empathize with Tom. We feel his love for Dickie Greenleaf -- we feel his frustration at being shut out of his life -- we feel the awkwardness of being trapped in a situation that was never intended. As we watched Marion Crane's car pause in the swamp and waited breathlessly, perversely hoping it would sink and allow Norman's mother to get away with murder, so too we watch Tom Ripley descend into darkness, and when the cops arrive at his hotel, we wait breathlessly with Tom, hoping he will get away.

Duality is present within us all... and while we are taught "to thine own self be true," in this film it is only when we are true to ourselves, that true pain comes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196734,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1999-12-25","keywords":"nudity,italy,sociopath,male frontal nudity,neo noir","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cate Blanchett Almost Played Clarice Starling?","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2861284889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUxOGZjNTYtYTM5NC00N2M2LTk5YmUtNDJkMGViZTUwNGEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUxOGZjNTYtYTM5NC00N2M2LTk5YmUtNDJkMGViZTUwNGEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Cate Blanchett has two Oscars and a resume of both big blockbusters and art house hits, but she's missed out on some roles along the way."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000569/","name":"Gwyneth Paltrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038270/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0383604/","name":"Patricia Highsmith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Singing and Dancing: A Musical History
Hollywood Singing And Dancing
programme.desc:
Hollywood Singing and Dancing: A Musical History: Directed by Mark McLaughlin. With Obba Babatundé, John Badham, Robert S. Birchard, Nikki Blonsky. A look at the history of musical movies hosted by Shirley Jones. Full of clips and behind the scenes stories that any movie buff will appreciate." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1267421/","name":"Hollywood Singing and Dancing: A Musical History","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE2MGMwNzMtNDVjNC00NDc2LTlhNDYtM2MyYmUwZWQ4NzFkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjAyMzE2MjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at the history of musical movies hosted by Shirley Jones. Full of clips and behind the scenes stories that any movie buff will appreciate.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1267421/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer"},"dateCreated":"2012-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One step beyond "That's Entertainment!"","reviewBody":"Back in the 1970s, "That's Entertainment" turned out to be a surprise hit, as folks flocked to the theaters to see a celebration of the MGM musical. It was a very good film and led to two sequels. However, the films are flawed in one way--they ignored the musicals of rival studios, such as RKO, MGM and Twentieth Century-Fox. So, for that reason alone, "Hollywood Singing and Dancing: A Musical History" is a better film for someone wanting to learn about the history of this genre. Now I am not saying it's perfect--but it is darn good because its clips are not restricted to a single studio.

So what are the film's deficits and assets? Well, on the plus side, it not only talks about ALL the studio's musicals but it also extends to today, since it's a new film. Also, the interviews are quite nice and there are tons of clips. On the negative side, the clips were occasionally fuzzy (especially the earlier ones) and the film is NOT completely comprehensive. Many important films are omitted and you'd get the impression that Busby Berkeley did EVERY musical from the 30s (he actually did far less than most people think). But this can be forgiven, you the film was not intended as a mini-series (which it really needed for so much material). Unless you absolutely hate musicals, this film is for you and well worth seeing.

By the way, I really wished the film had talked about some of the flops of the genre--such as "Camelot", "Paint Your Wagon", "Can't Stop the Music" or "Xanadu" (among others). Now THAT would make for an interesting film!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"genre":["Documentary","Musical"],"datePublished":"2008-10-14","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044762/","name":"Obba Babatundé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000824/","name":"John Badham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083306/","name":"Robert S. Birchard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572385/","name":"Mark McLaughlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0227529/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1415454/","name":"Phillip Dye"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2854060/","name":"Denise Hamilton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1238474/","name":"Tasha Lowe-Newsome"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

By the way, I really wished the film had talked about some of the flops of the genre--such as "Camelot", "Paint Your Wagon", "Can't Stop the Music" or "Xanadu" (among others). Now THAT would make for an interesting film!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"genre":["Documentary","Musical"],"datePublished":"2008-10-14","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044762/","name":"Obba Babatundé","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000824/","name":"John Badham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083306/","name":"Robert S. programme.title: Zoom
Zoom
programme.desc:
Zoom: Directed by Peter Hewitt. With Tim Allen, Courteney Cox, Chevy Chase, Spencer Breslin. Former superhero Jack is called back to work to transform an unlikely group of ragtag kids into superheroes at a private academy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0383060/","name":"Zoom","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0NjczMzUyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDEwMjQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Former superhero Jack is called back to work to transform an unlikely group of ragtag kids into superheroes at a private academy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0383060/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jimbo-72"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Learn how to watch and rate movies people (rated for balance only)","reviewBody":"The people who rated this movie 1-star should get their heads out of their posteriors. 

Too many movie-goers these days seem to only see movies as either being the best thing ever or the worst thing ever. The only way a movie should get 10 stars is if it would be difficult to improve upon and the only way a movie should get 1 star is if it was absolutely ineptly made on every level, and I assure you this movie doesn't come close to that. Even solely rating on personal taste and ignoring the technical filmmaking and how successfully the movie achieves the filmmakers' apparent intent, this movie could hardly be in the worst 10% of movies for anyone's taste.

This movie fails in many respects, but it has some redeeming moments and taken as a movie for small kids, it's not bad. The humor and acting both fall flat or miss the mark about as often as they're on target, but that is a sign of mediocrity, not atrocity.

Unfortunately at this point most of the IMDb users seem to think that if they enjoyed a movie they should give it a 10 and if it wasn't all they hoped for they should give it a 1. For instance the Lord of the Rings movies were entertaining, but have no business being rated higher than Citizen Kane or any of the countless classics relegated to lower ranks here. Similarly. Zoom has no business being rated lower than a piece of garbage like I Accuse My Parents which wasn't even watchable when it was skewered on Mystery Science Theater 3000.

Remember folks most movies are mediocre. That means a low rating, not the bottom rating. Furthermore, just because a movie is exciting or satisfying doesn't make it a 10. For example, one can love the original Star Wars movies and still realize they have occasional flaws in acting, direction, pacing, or script.

Is Zoom a great movie? Absolutely not. Will some children, some parents, and even some adults without children enjoy it? Yes. Will it go down in history for being remarkable in any way? Probably not.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-08-11","keywords":"superhero,female hero,teenage superhero,superhero team,invisible man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Zoom (2006)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2112028953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ3NDM3ZjYtOGFhYS00ZTU3LThhMmYtYTdlNjExODVlM2M5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ3NDM3ZjYtOGFhYS00ZTU3LThhMmYtYTdlNjExODVlM2M5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"pre st, "This Summer", "August", lbx"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000741/","name":"Tim Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001073/","name":"Courteney Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000331/","name":"Chevy Chase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0382072/","name":"Peter Hewitt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050544/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080834/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726472/","name":"Adam Rifkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183854/","name":"David Berenbaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504670/","name":"Jason Lethcoe"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Too many movie-goers these days seem to only see movies as either being the best thing ever or the worst thing ever. The only way a movie should get 10 stars is if it would be difficult to improve upon and the only way a movie should get 1 star is if it was absolutely ineptly made on every level, and I assure you this movie doesn't come close to that. programme.title: Age of the Dragons
Doba zmaja
programme.desc:
Age of the Dragons: Directed by Ryan Little. With Danny Glover, Vinnie Jones, Corey Sevier, Sofia Pernas. Herman Melville's classic novel Moby Dick, is recreated in a world where Captain Ahab and his crew search for a Great White Dragon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1594917/","name":"Age of the Dragons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ2MTg4NjA2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzY2NzcwOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Herman Melville's classic novel Moby Dick, is recreated in a world where Captain Ahab and his crew search for a Great White Dragon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1594917/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tim851"},"dateCreated":"2011-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a horrible, horrible movie","reviewBody":"I thought the basic idea to remake Moby Dick in a slightly steam-punk version with dragons was intriguing enough. Sure, this is probably not gonna be a film for the ages, but it could be entertaining for ninety minutes.

But it's just horrible. Oh so horrible. The acting is some of the worst I have ever seen, if I account for the fact that they did indeed use professional actors. Danny Glover and Vinnie Jones have never been praised for their craft when playing the shallow roles they've played before. Here now, they are cast in character roles and that is a disaster. Jones tries to summon some gravitas by constantly suckling on this wee pipe of his and it looked ridiculous. The other male actors are underwhelming at best. They seem to have been selected because they all resemble other (more talented) actors.

The female lead was clearly cast based on "Who was the hottest chick that showed up?" Her acting is the worst.

The screenplay is just clown shoes. But the real highlight of this thing is the "ship". It looks like a carrack without sails, but wheels instead. It moves forward by means of ... erm, nobody knows. At the very least, they should have lamp-shaded it. But no.

This thing is only a 2/10 because the dragon special effects are somewhat decent. Somewhat. Otherwise it would be a 1/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4398,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2013-12-04","keywords":"downward spiral,dragon,revenge,harpooner,sword and sorcery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Age Of The Dragons","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3116014873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMzY3MjMyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU5NjQ2NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMzY3MjMyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU5NjQ2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Age Of The Dragons"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000418/","name":"Danny Glover"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005068/","name":"Vinnie Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786417/","name":"Corey Sevier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0514662/","name":"Ryan Little"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0111135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076345/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011582/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1384611/","name":"McKay Daines"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2249135/","name":"Gil Aglaure"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1237224/","name":"Anne K. programme.title: Summer Catch

programme.desc: Summer Catch: Directed by Michael Tollin. With Freddie Prinze Jr., Jessica Biel, Fred Ward, Matthew Lillard. A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0234829/","name":"Summer Catch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzE0MDRjOTMtODM1Ni00ODdiLTgxN2QtZGZlMmEwNWFlMWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0234829/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"camcurwood"},"dateCreated":"2002-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could have been better than what it was","reviewBody":"As some users have commented, the crude jokes were a bit much, and indeed they were. They were quite out of place in the movie - it was almost like watching two different movies at once - not in a good way. There was quite a bit of needless dialogue and interaction, almost all of it dealing with the crudeness and offensive jokes mainly directed at women. \n\nThe other parts of the movie were not bad, and I wish there was more of them. The interaction with the father could have been expanded, as well as the brother. The scenes with Jessica were good, and the baseball scenes were ok, and quite well made. Unfortunately, the plot was a bit predictable, with my girlfriend shouting out what she thought would happen next, and she was always right. The crude parts and predictable plot drag the rest of the movie down. I debated whether to give it a 4 - thinking I slightly disliked it, or if I was neutral and would give it a 5. In the end, it had to be 4.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15698,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-08-24","keywords":"girl wears panties,chatham massachusetts,peroxide blonde,female removes her clothes,braless teen","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Summer Catch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1502347545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU2MzQxMzQtMmNjMS00YTdlLWFjM2UtZmUwMGIxNWZiOThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU2MzQxMzQtMmNjMS00YTdlLWFjM2UtZmUwMGIxNWZiOThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005327/","name":"Freddie Prinze Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911542/","name":"Fred Ward"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0866132/","name":"Michael Tollin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099647/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266468/","name":"Kevin Falls"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0309691/","name":"John Gatins"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0234829, Title: Summer Catch, --- Description: Summer Catch: Directed by Michael Tollin. With Freddie Prinze Jr., Jessica Biel, Fred Ward, Matthew Lillard. A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0234829/","name":"Summer Catch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzE0MDRjOTMtODM1Ni00ODdiLTgxN2QtZGZlMmEwNWFlMWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0234829/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"camcurwood","dateCreated":"2002-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could have been better than what it was","reviewBody":"As some users have commented, the crude jokes were a bit much, and indeed they were. They were quite out of place in the movie - it was almost like watching two different movies at once - not in a good way. There was quite a bit of needless dialogue and interaction, almost all of it dealing with the crudeness and offensive jokes mainly directed at women. \n\nThe other parts of the movie were not bad, and I wish there was more of them. The interaction with the father could have been expanded, as well as the brother. The scenes with Jessica were good, and the baseball scenes were ok, and quite well made. Unfortunately, the plot was a bit predictable, with my girlfriend shouting out what she thought would happen next, and she was always right. The crude parts and predictable plot drag the rest of the movie down. I debated whether to give it a 4 - thinking I slightly disliked it, or if I was neutral and would give it a 5. In the end, it had to be 4.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15698,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-08-24","keywords":"girl wears panties,chatham massachusetts,peroxide blonde,female removes her clothes,braless teen","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Summer Catch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1502347545","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU2MzQxMzQtMmNjMS00YTdlLWFjM2UtZmUwMGIxNWZiOThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU2MzQxMzQtMmNjMS00YTdlLWFjM2UtZmUwMGIxNWZiOThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005327/","name":"Freddie Prinze Jr.","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911542/","name":"Fred Ward"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0866132/","name":"Michael Tollin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099647/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266468/","name":"Kevin Falls","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0309691/","name":"John Gatins"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Serendipity
Igra sudbine
programme.desc:
Serendipity: Directed by Peter Chelsom. With John Cusack, Kate Beckinsale, Jeremy Piven, Bridget Moynahan. A couple search for each other years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0240890/","name":"Serendipity","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFhZTc4NDEtNDA0MS00NmFiLWFlNzUtMDM0NTExNjc3NzZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzI0NDc4ODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple search for each other years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FlickJunkie-2"},"dateCreated":"2002-05-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enchanting romantic comedy","reviewBody":"This charming romantic comedy has all the right ingredients and serves up a bouillabaisse of schmaltzy romance and slapstick fun. Jonathan (John Cusack) and Sara (Kate Beckinsale) meet in Bloomingdales when they both want to purchase the same pair of gloves. The attraction is instant and they spend a romantic evening cavorting around New York City together. At the end of the evening John wants to see her again, but Sara decides that if it is fate that they should be together, they will find each other again. She drives away in a cab and he never sees her again. Well, almost never.

Years go by and both of them are about to be married, but each still has this nagging feeling that the other was his/her one true love. Of course fate conspires to bring them back together (after about a dozen near misses) as they each simultaneously undertake one last attempt to find one another just before they get married to someone else.

The fate angle is plowed mercilessly, almost to the point of nausea, but the skits are funny and the chemistry between Cusack and Beckinsale is enchanting. Cusack is an expert at playing the tortured and neurotic lover, but here he is more haunted and forlorn than dysfunctional, and it plays much better than his previous two characters in `High Fidelity' and `America's Sweethearts'. 

Kate Beckinsale rocketed from obscurity to prominence with her performance in `Pearl Harbor' and proves to be a wonderful romantic lead in this film. She is breezy and adorable and spins a delightful web around Jonathan and the viewer. The film also benefits from outstanding comedic support from Jeremy Piven as Jonathan's best friend and devoted Sara sleuth. Piven's zany comedy proves to be the perfect complement to Cusack's wry despondency. Eugene Levy is a scream as the eccentric Bloomingdales salesman, who blackmails Jonathan into buying half the store to give him information from Sara's charge account.

All in all, this is an entertaining comedy that is insubstantial but delectable. I tend to give romantic comedies a little more slack, because I'm a sucker for this slush, and this is one of the better ones I've seen in a while so I rated it a 9/10. This lighthearted romp makes a great date flick, but if serious drama is your preference stay away.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-04-03","keywords":"fate,destiny,serendipity,christmas,coincidence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Serendipity","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi735092249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NjEwNDYtZTM4ZS00OWRiLTlmZWMtYjljODgwOWQxNjkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NjEwNDYtZTM4ZS00OWRiLTlmZWMtYjljODgwOWQxNjkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #3"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000295/","name":"Kate Beckinsale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005315/","name":"Jeremy Piven"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155093/","name":"Peter Chelsom"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018522/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044742/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458884/","name":"Marc Klein"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: xXx
xXx
programme.desc: xXx: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Vin Diesel, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas, Samuel L. Jackson. An extreme sports athlete, Xander Cage, is recruited by the government on a special mission." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0295701/","name":"xXx","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZjZmM1ZDctNDhlZi00Mzk1LWFjNWItYzIxNGY2OWYzYjJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ2MjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An extreme sports athlete, Xander Cage, is recruited by the government on a special mission.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0295701/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmuntmootcourt"},"dateCreated":"2005-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not exactly smart entertainment, but fun.","reviewBody":"Look, I'm not going to pretend that this is some sort of masterpiece. Though it is basically another "generic action flick", the twists that they add to it make it worth watching. The way they incorporate their "recruitment program" into the movie is fun and original, and though Vin Diesel doesn't really "act" in it, it's a lot of fun to watch. It has a few suspenseful plot elements, and the way they incorporate his status as an extreme sports star (not a spoiler, it's in the previews) into the way he conducts himself as a secret agent makes it more believable. Ever think about some of the stunts that go on in an action movie and wonder, "Okay, exactly WHY would this particular person know how to do that?", because it seems completely unlikely that there would be some sort of training program for the stunt they just pulled off? This movie doesn't have that, because whether he's on a motorcycle, skis, or whatever, you can believe that an extreme sports star would be able to pull off what he's doing. Though the plot is as unrealistic as most movies of this genre, the stunts are a lot more believable than you'll find in most.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":176687,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-09-11","keywords":"time bomb,kidnapping,tattoo on torso,adventure hero,physical skill","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"xXx","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi451084569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYxNjc0OGItNWY2ZS00ZmRjLTlhOTEtNmI1MTFjZDk3ZTY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYxNjc0OGItNWY2ZS00ZmRjLTlhOTEtNmI1MTFjZDk3ZTY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004874/","name":"Vin Diesel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000782/","name":"Asia Argento"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190744/","name":"Marton Csokas"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929186/","name":"Rich Wilkes"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Eye
Oko
programme.desc: The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNjg3OTQyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjkyMzU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"robertallenandersonjr"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make it sound","reviewBody":"The Eye was not a great movie but it's not horrible either. It was about an average movie. I was not expecting a lot going into seeing this movie. If you are expecting a lot going into this movie it will not be good but if your just looking to see a movie and thinking its going to be good you might actually like it. Pretty much the whole entire beginning and almost all of the middle was boring and just had very sudden scenes that would get you to jump out of your seat. The rest of the movie was when it started to kick up and get good. Jessica Alba finally started to find out what she had to do and what was going on with her and people around her. Thats when the action started and it had you on the edge of your seat. For the most part it was pretty slow moving and boring but then it kicked up it was good. If the first hour of the movie was like the end it would have of been an excellent movie. So if your looking for a pretty scary movie with lots of things that pop out at you go see this. The story was actually pretty good as well. The fact that it made you wait to find out why she became blind was well done. The acting job Jessica Alba did was good as well. The visual effects for this movie were also awesome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52791,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"robertallenandersonjr","dateCreated":"2008-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make it sound","reviewBody":"The Eye was not a great movie but it's not horrible either. It was about an average movie. I was not expecting a lot going into seeing this movie. If you are expecting a lot going into this movie it will not be good but if your just looking to see a movie and thinking its going to be good you might actually like it. Pretty much the whole entire beginning and almost all of the middle was boring and just had very sudden scenes that would get you to jump out of your seat. The rest of the movie was when it started to kick up and get good. Jessica Alba finally started to find out what she had to do and what was going on with her and people around her. Thats when the action started and it had you on the edge of your seat. For the most part it was pretty slow moving and boring but then it kicked up it was good. If the first hour of the movie was like the end it would have of been an excellent movie. So if your looking for a pretty scary movie with lots of things that pop out at you go see this. The story was actually pretty good as well. The fact that it made you wait to find out why she became blind was well done. The acting job Jessica Alba did was good as well. programme.title: Navy CIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Svaki član NCIS-a mora preuzeti odgovornost za posljedice svojih postupaka, počevši od Pridea. Loretta se uključuje u predizbornu kampanju. Kriminalistička serija pod nazivom Navy CSI New Orleans prikazuje tim specijalnih agenata koji istražuju slučajeve vezane uz vojno osoblje New Orleansa. Vođa tima agenata jest pravedni i hrabri Dwayne koji strastveno riješava svaki zadatak koji mu je dodijeljen.

programme.title: Profileri
programme.desc: Francuska serija pod nazivom "Profileri" predstavlja Chloé, kriminalističku psihologinju koja istražuje ubojice kako bi pomogla riješiti slučajeve zločina. Chloé Saint-Laurent je profiler i radi s policijskim timom za rješavanje ubojstva u Parizu. Ona je vrlo draga, nosi jako obojenu odjeću i veliku žutu torbu. Izgleda poput djevojčice koja treba lutku, ali je vrlo pametna i jako dobar profiler. Korak po korak, uklopit će se u tim a njezine kolege, u početku jako pridržane, postaju joj najbolji prijatelji.

programme.title: Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Nakon što se deset godina klonila profesionalnog svijeta, Candice Renoir, plavuša i majka četvero djece, vrhovna je zapovjednica skupine istražitelja. Candice Renoir ima četvero djece, a nije radila deset godina kako bi pratila njezinog muža u inozemstvu. Sada rastavljena od muža, preuzima posao voditeljice istražnog tima javne sigurnosti na jugu Francuske. Na čelu ovog novog tima, ona mora dokazati da je dobra u svom poslu. Iskustvo, vještina promatranja , analitičke sposobnosti i oštroumnost pomažu joj u rješavanju istraga.

credits.actor: Kiefer Sutherland, Natascha McElhone, Paulo Costanzo, Adan Canto, Italia Ricci, LaMonica Garrett, Zoe McLellan, Ben Lawson

programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, A.J. Buckley, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr.. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19525,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"military,u.s. military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0118568/","name":"A.J. Buckley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="
